title: Searching for a slutty 70s font
content:
Hello everybody.

I’m searching for a display type (maybe a script?!) that looks slutty (uups! Sorry!) and is from the 70s. Last point is not a must-have. First I thought of Bello. But I think it looks a bit too friendly and is not bold enough!? Is there a font that the sex-business-industry preferred in the 70s!? Hope that you can help me.

Thanks

Steven
author: Steven Wulf

comments.content:
You probably can’t much seventies-sluttier than Russ Meyers...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310im_/http:/typophile.com/files/536.jpg)
Souvenir?

Probably, unless you look to Ted. V. Mikels.

[http://www.tedvmikels.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.tedvmikels.com/ "http://www.tedvmikels.com/")
Is there an alternative font to cooper black or souvenir with swash capitals!?

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pandora%20Peaks.jpg)
  
I think I like the letters of Pandora Peaks most!? Does anyone know the name of the font!?
Its [Harlow](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.linotype.com/520/harlow-family.html), Steven.
Thank you Dan
Thread re. Cooper Black Swash - [http://www.typophile.com/node/15256](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15256 "http://www.typophile.com/node/15256")
Thank you too sii

One more - Bookman Swash - [http://www.typophile.com/node/9721](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.typophile.com/node/9721 "http://www.typophile.com/node/9721")

Si

\> Is there a font that the sex-business-industry preferred in the 70s!?

“How did this get in here?!? Someones playing a prank on me! Honestly its not mine!

_Its Harlow, Steven._

As Vivien Leigh said of Jean Harlow, “The ’t’ is silent”.

You might also find these rather ’slutty’. Saline fron FontBank and [MotterFeminaEF](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/motter-femina-sh/).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310im_/http:/typophile.com/files/salinemotter.png)

Is Saline the same as [Tango](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/tango/) or is it a saltier version?  
How about [Octopuss](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/octopuss-sh/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/octopuss-sh/)  
Tim
Tango is a great call - what an awful font. Between this and (what we called when I was likkle) Eastern Souvenir there’s not a lot to choose.

Awful? I love that font! Awful is most of the stuff on DaFont. This is truly a time capsule of a font.

=^D
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%202.png)
Nothing personal about the font - anything you were MADE to use was awful - you had to be there -

\>you had to be there -

Yikes, under what dictatorship were you forced to use Tango?

Uuuuhhh yeah! Tango is slutty!  
I like it alot! :)

I can’t make a decision
Joe’s Tango Tandoori post - [http://blog.fawny.org/2006/03/14/tango/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/blog.fawny.org/2006/03/14/tango/ "http://blog.fawny.org/2006/03/14/tango/")
chalet 70’s !

Candice!!

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/candice/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/candice/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/candice/")

I’m astonished “slutty” isn’t a keyword at myfonts.com.
I was thinking Candice as well. Seems a tad over used in the past couple of years though.

[Beyonce](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0000A0BQ7/sr=8-6/qid=1142972241/ref=sr_1_6/103-8856371-3383808?%5Fencoding=UTF8) used it on her single for “Crazy in Love” and is also using it on iTunes. She seems like a nice girl that just happens to be bootylicious, but I wouldn’t call her slutty.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043310im_/http:/typophile.com/files/beyonceimage.png)
Darn wrong font. Oh well here’s another one that you lot might think is slutty.
That (Beyonce) is Motter Femina also mentioned above.
